shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 1r-142vb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 1r–109v, fols. 120r–131v) I-2) Mäḫalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 109v–119v, fols. 132r–132v), incomplete I-3) Mäḫalǝyä mäḫalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 132v–138v) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 138va-142vb), incomplete
Additio 1.

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 18th - first half of the 19th cent.(?)

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is very worn. The front board is broken; the back board is missing. The Ms. has been resewn; only 2nd and 3rd sewing stations has been used. The front board attachment is almost totally destroyed. Many leaves are covered with dirt stains and some are destroyed by rodents. Some folios are missing, some folios are misplaced. Not more than two fols. are missing between fols. 119 and 132 containing the Prayer of Isaiah and the beginning of the Prayer of Our Lady Mary from Lk. 1:52. The final part of Text I-4 is missing. The proper arrangement of fols. is as follows: 1-2, 5-12, 3-4, 120-131, 13-119, 132-142. Some leaves are damaged, with portions of the text lost (e.g., fols. 104, 131, 142 etc.) Holes carefully amended on fols. 12, 74.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken, the back board is missing). One pair of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
I(4/fols. 1r-4v) – II(8/fols. 5r-12v) – ፫III(12/fols. 13r-24v) – [፬]IV(12/fols. 25r-36v) – ፭V(12/fols. 37r-48v) – VI(12/fols. 49r-60v) – ፯VII(12/fols. 61r-72v) – ፰VIII(12/fols. 73r-84v) – ፱IX(12/fols. 85r-96v) – ፲X(12/fols. 97r-108v) – XI(11/fols. 109r-119v) – XII(12/fols. 120r-131v) – XIII(11/fols. 132r-142v) – {B(2/fols. 143r-144v)}.
The structure of quires cannot be exactly determined due to the poor condition of the Ms. The leaves making up quire B originate from another Ms.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 8r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text I-4: all data for fol. 140r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are mostly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C (text area I); 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C (text area II). Primary pricks are not visible. Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 17r). Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Second half of the 18th - first half of the 19th century (?)

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of the Virgin Mary in Text I-4); titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; numbers of Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3 and I-5; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; name and traditional interpretation of the first letter, Aleph, in Ps. 118; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-4.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Text I-4 ሰ፡ ቅ፡ or ሰ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ (ለነ፡) ቅድስት፡ Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 138vb-139rb) እ፡/እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 139vb-141ra) ኵ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fol. 142va-vb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters (except for Aleph) in Ps. 118 is missing. - Ps. 85 is mistakenly numbered as 77 (fol. 61r). Pss. 115, 116, 117 are mistakenly numbered as 114, 115, 116 respectively (fols. 87r-88v). Pss. 124, 125 are mistakenly numbered as 123, 124 respectively (fol. 96v). Ps. 145 is mistakenly numbered as 146 (fol. 107r). - In Text I-2, the First Prayer of Moses begins on fol. 109v (Ex. 15:1-2a), then continues on fol. 118r, 118v (Ex. 15:2b up to the end). On fol. 119v, Text I-2 ends with the Prayer of Habakkuk; of the following Prayer of Isaiah, only the heading is present. Another part of Text I-2 is contained on fol. 132: the Prayer of Our Lady Mary from Lk. 1:52 up to the end, the Prayer of Zechariah and the Prayer of Simeon.

additional.cont: Fols. 143ra–144vb: Hymn in praise of various saints (?), fragment.
additional.det: The text is written on a bifolio originating from another, older Ms.(?) The text is partly illegible due to a water stain and faded ink.

extras.extra: - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating black and red dots. - Omitted letters, words or lines written interlineally, in two different secondary hands: e.g., fols. 2v, 14v, 16r, 20v, 27r, 29v, 31r, 33v, 34v, 42v, 44r, 59v, 76v, 92v, 101r, 107r, 118v, 119r, 128v. - Corrections written over erasures, in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 32r, 35r, 65r, 72v, 80v, 83v, 126v. - Erasures: fols. 24r, 34v, 56v, 57r, 78r, 101v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Undecorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of fols. 13r, 37r, 61r, 73r, 85r, 97r.

frames.frame: 1) In Text I, every group consisting of 10 psalms is separated from similar groups preceding and following it by a chain of black and red dots 2) Fol. 109v: Row of nine dot asterisks 3) Fol. 132v: Chain of black and red dots 4) Fol. 138v: Two chains of black and red dots with a row of nine dot asterisks between them.
